item.title: Deceased fox, 24th January
item.description:
I found a deceased fox today in my garden. I’ve bagged it and put outside the house in a black bin for protection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mountview Road, Goddington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous fly tipping on the pavement, 24th January
item.description:
For some time now, an individual has been regularly arriving late in the evening and leaving building rubble, along with large cardboard packaging materials, including polystyrene, on the public pavement outside my property. Although construction work is currently taking place in my house, this waste is not related to any work being carried out at my address. Initially, we cleared the waste ourselves on several occasions, believing it to be a one-off occurrence. However, the dumping has continued and has now become a persistent and recurring problem. This is causing inconvenience, obstructing the pavement, and raising concerns regarding cleanliness and safety. I would appreciate it if this matter could be investigated and appropriate action taken to prevent further occurrences. Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 rolls Royces permanently parked and covered on road, 24th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Dulwich Village, Dulwich Village, Greater London

item.title: Extensive footway and carriageway flooding, 24th January
item.description:
Halfway Street zebra crossing near Days Lane junction. The footway and carriageway gullies are blocked resulting in extensive flooding. This fault has persisted for over 6 years and Bexley Council repeatedly fails to resolve the fault and just closes reports without explanation. The flooding causes particular hazard to pedestrians, particularly those with limited mobility. The continuing failure by Bexley Council to resolve this fault is deeply disrespectful to the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 243-247A, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
